trans-unit.source: Step 3: Generate the Schema for the Flat File Message
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Generate the Schema for the Flat File Message

trans-unit.source: As described in the business scenario, Northwind Traders sends a flat file message to Humongous Insurance.
trans-unit.target: As described in the business scenario, Northwind Traders sends a flat file message to Humongous Insurance.

trans-unit.source: For Humongous Insurance, to process the message by using a one-way <token>bridge</token>, it must have the schema of the flat file message as part of the <token>msgflow_proj</token> created in the last step.
trans-unit.target: For Humongous Insurance, to process the message by using a one-way <token>bridge</token>, it must have the schema of the flat file message as part of the <token>msgflow_proj</token> created in the last step.

trans-unit.source: <token>af_integration</token> provides a <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema Wizard</embeddedLabel> that generates a flat-file schema from an existing flat-file instance message.
trans-unit.target: <token>af_integration</token> provides a <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema Wizard</embeddedLabel> that generates a flat-file schema from an existing flat-file instance message.

trans-unit.source: Humongous Insurance uses the flat-file message instance message that it received from Northwind Traders (out of band, over e-mail) and then uses the <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema Wizard</embeddedLabel> to create the schema.
trans-unit.target: Humongous Insurance uses the flat-file message instance message that it received from Northwind Traders (out of band, over e-mail) and then uses the <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema Wizard</embeddedLabel> to create the schema.

trans-unit.source: Assume that the flat file message (<embeddedLabel>SampleInsuranceClaim.txt</embeddedLabel>) that is sent to Humongous Insurance, looks like the following:
trans-unit.target: Assume that the flat file message (<embeddedLabel>SampleInsuranceClaim.txt</embeddedLabel>) that is sent to Humongous Insurance, looks like the following:

trans-unit.source: This topic demonstrates how to use the Flat File Schema wizard to generate a flat file schema by using <embeddedLabel>SampleInsuranceClaim.txt</embeddedLabel> as the input instance message.
trans-unit.target: This topic demonstrates how to use the Flat File Schema wizard to generate a flat file schema by using <embeddedLabel>SampleInsuranceClaim.txt</embeddedLabel> as the input instance message.

trans-unit.source: The sample file is also provided with the solution (<embeddedLabel>FlatFile_Bridge_Integration</embeddedLabel>) available as a download from <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=249449</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=249449</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The sample file is also provided with the solution (<embeddedLabel>FlatFile_Bridge_Integration</embeddedLabel>) available as a download from <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=249449</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=249449</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: To use the Flat File Schema wizard
trans-unit.target: To use the Flat File Schema wizard

trans-unit.source: Right-click the <embeddedLabel>FlatFile_Bridge</embeddedLabel> project, point to <ui>Add</ui>, and then click <ui>New Item</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the <embeddedLabel>FlatFile_Bridge</embeddedLabel> project, point to <ui>Add</ui>, and then click <ui>New Item</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Add New Item</ui> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Generate Flat File Schema</embeddedLabel>, enter a name for the schema as <userInput>InsuranceClaim.xsd</userInput>, and then click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Add New Item</ui> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Generate Flat File Schema</embeddedLabel>, enter a name for the schema as <userInput>InsuranceClaim.xsd</userInput>, and then click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The Flat File Schema Wizard starts.
trans-unit.target: The Flat File Schema Wizard starts.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Flat File Schema Information</ui> screen, select your instance and enter the following information.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Flat File Schema Information</ui> screen, select your instance and enter the following information.

trans-unit.source: When you are done, click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.
trans-unit.target: When you are done, click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Instance file:</ui> Click the <ui>Browse</ui> button to locate the flat file from which the schema will be generated.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Instance file:</ui> Click the <ui>Browse</ui> button to locate the flat file from which the schema will be generated.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the folder that contains the text file you created in the Prerequisites section.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the folder that contains the text file you created in the Prerequisites section.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Record name:</ui> Type <userInputLocalizable>SourceClaim</userInputLocalizable>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Record name:</ui> Type <userInputLocalizable>SourceClaim</userInputLocalizable>.

trans-unit.source: The value you specify here is the schema root name.
trans-unit.target: The value you specify here is the schema root name.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Target namespace:</ui> Accept the default, <userInputLocalizable>http://FlatFile_Bridge.InsuranceClaim</userInputLocalizable> for schema target namespace.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Target namespace:</ui> Accept the default, <userInputLocalizable>http://FlatFile_Bridge.InsuranceClaim</userInputLocalizable> for schema target namespace.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Select Document Data</ui> screen, the contents of the flat file are displayed.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Select Document Data</ui> screen, the contents of the flat file are displayed.

trans-unit.source: Select the data needed for creating the schema, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select the data needed for creating the schema, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In this walkthrough, because we are using the entire document instance, you can press <ui>Ctrl-A</ui> to select all.
trans-unit.target: In this walkthrough, because we are using the entire document instance, you can press <ui>Ctrl-A</ui> to select all.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Select Record Format</ui> screen, you specify whether the records are formatted using a delimiter symbol or by defining relative positions.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Select Record Format</ui> screen, you specify whether the records are formatted using a delimiter symbol or by defining relative positions.

trans-unit.source: In the instance message we chose, the records are delimited using a pipe symbol (|), hence select <ui>By delimiter symbol</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the instance message we chose, the records are delimited using a pipe symbol (|), hence select <ui>By delimiter symbol</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> screen, enter the following to define the first level of the schema and when you are done, click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> screen, enter the following to define the first level of the schema and when you are done, click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Child delimiter:</ui> Select <ui>|</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Child delimiter:</ui> Select <ui>|</ui>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Escape character:</ui> An escape character is a single character that suppresses any special meaning of the character that follows it.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Escape character:</ui> An escape character is a single character that suppresses any special meaning of the character that follows it.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Escape Characters</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=245838</linkUri></externalLink> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Escape Characters</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=245838</linkUri></externalLink> for more information.

trans-unit.source: For this walkthrough, leave this blank.
trans-unit.target: For this walkthrough, leave this blank.

trans-unit.source: When using <userInputLocalizable>\</userInputLocalizable>, <userInputLocalizable>{,</userInputLocalizable> and <userInputLocalizable>}</userInputLocalizable> for <ui>Child delimiter</ui> or <ui>Escape character</ui>, a back slash must be used.
trans-unit.target: When using <userInputLocalizable>\</userInputLocalizable>, <userInputLocalizable>{,</userInputLocalizable> and <userInputLocalizable>}</userInputLocalizable> for <ui>Child delimiter</ui> or <ui>Escape character</ui>, a back slash must be used.

trans-unit.source: For example, <userInputLocalizable>\\,</userInputLocalizable> and <userInputLocalizable>\{</userInputLocalizable>.
trans-unit.target: For example, <userInputLocalizable>\\,</userInputLocalizable> and <userInputLocalizable>\{</userInputLocalizable>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.

trans-unit.source: The wizard identifies five elements in the <embeddedLabel>SourceClaim</embeddedLabel> record.
trans-unit.target: The wizard identifies five elements in the <embeddedLabel>SourceClaim</embeddedLabel> record.

trans-unit.source: Enter values for the elements as illustrated in the following table to define the elements under <embeddedLabel>SourceClaim</embeddedLabel> record:
trans-unit.target: Enter values for the elements as illustrated in the following table to define the elements under <embeddedLabel>SourceClaim</embeddedLabel> record:

trans-unit.source: Element Name
trans-unit.target: Element Name

trans-unit.source: Element Type
trans-unit.target: Element Type

trans-unit.source: Data Type
trans-unit.target: Data Type

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>ClaimID</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>ClaimID</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>Field Element</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>Field Element</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>positiveInteger</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>positiveInteger</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>ClaimType</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>ClaimType</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>FieldElement</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>FieldElement</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>string</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>string</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>ClaimAmount</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>ClaimAmount</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>FieldElement</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>FieldElement</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>double</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>double</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>PersonInfo</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>PersonInfo</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>Record</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>Record</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>PolicyId</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>PolicyId</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>FieldElement</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>FieldElement</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>string</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>string</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.

trans-unit.source: After you click <ui>Next</ui> on the <ui>Child Elements</ui> screen, you will not be able to click <ui>Back</ui> to redefine or make any changes to the child elements.
trans-unit.target: After you click <ui>Next</ui> on the <ui>Child Elements</ui> screen, you will not be able to click <ui>Back</ui> to redefine or make any changes to the child elements.

trans-unit.source: For any changes, restart the wizard to define the flat file schema.
trans-unit.target: For any changes, restart the wizard to define the flat file schema.

trans-unit.source: After you complete the steps until here, the first level of the schema is generated as shown in the <embeddedLabel>Schema View</embeddedLabel> page.
trans-unit.target: After you complete the steps until here, the first level of the schema is generated as shown in the <embeddedLabel>Schema View</embeddedLabel> page.

trans-unit.source: Because we defined <ui>PersonInfo</ui> as a <ui>Record</ui> type, the Flat File Schema Wizard now continues to further define the <embeddedLabel>PersonInfo</embeddedLabel> record.
trans-unit.target: Because we defined <ui>PersonInfo</ui> as a <ui>Record</ui> type, the Flat File Schema Wizard now continues to further define the <embeddedLabel>PersonInfo</embeddedLabel> record.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Schema View</ui> page, select <ui>PersonInfo</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Schema View</ui> page, select <ui>PersonInfo</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Select Document Data</ui> page, select the segment that corresponds to the <embeddedLabel>PersonInfo</embeddedLabel> record, as shown in the image below, and then click <ui>Next</ui> to define its child elements.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Select Document Data</ui> page, select the segment that corresponds to the <embeddedLabel>PersonInfo</embeddedLabel> record, as shown in the image below, and then click <ui>Next</ui> to define its child elements.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Select Record Format</ui> page, select <ui>By delimiter symbol</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Select Record Format</ui> page, select <ui>By delimiter symbol</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Choose this option because the elements within the <embeddedLabel>PersonInfo</embeddedLabel> record are delimited using a symbol, semicolon (<embeddedLabel>;</embeddedLabel>).
trans-unit.target: Choose this option because the elements within the <embeddedLabel>PersonInfo</embeddedLabel> record are delimited using a symbol, semicolon (<embeddedLabel>;</embeddedLabel>).

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> page, enter the following to define the <embeddedLabel>PersonalInfo</embeddedLabel> record.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> page, enter the following to define the <embeddedLabel>PersonalInfo</embeddedLabel> record.

trans-unit.source: When you are done, click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When you are done, click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>;</ui> from <ui>Child delimiter</ui> drop-down selection list.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>;</ui> from <ui>Child delimiter</ui> drop-down selection list.

trans-unit.source: Leave the <ui>Escape character</ui> text box blank.
trans-unit.target: Leave the <ui>Escape character</ui> text box blank.

trans-unit.source: Using the values from the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> page, the wizard identifies four child elements.
trans-unit.target: Using the values from the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> page, the wizard identifies four child elements.

trans-unit.source: Provide values for the record elements as suggested in the following table.
trans-unit.target: Provide values for the record elements as suggested in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Element Name
trans-unit.target: Element Name

trans-unit.source: Element Type
trans-unit.target: Element Type

trans-unit.source: Data Type
trans-unit.target: Data Type

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>Name</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>Name</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>Field Element</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>Field Element</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>string</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>string</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>Address</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>Address</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>FieldElement</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>FieldElement</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>string</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>string</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>City</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>City</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>FieldElement</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>FieldElement</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>string</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>string</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>State</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>State</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>FieldElement</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>FieldElement</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>string</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>string</userInput>

trans-unit.source: You have defined all the nodes for the <embeddedLabel>SourceClaim</embeddedLabel> schema.
trans-unit.target: You have defined all the nodes for the <embeddedLabel>SourceClaim</embeddedLabel> schema.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Schema View</ui> page, click <ui>Finish</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Schema View</ui> page, click <ui>Finish</ui>.

trans-unit.source: After you click <embeddedLabel>Finish</embeddedLabel>, the schema file you created, <embeddedLabel>InsuranceClaim.xsd</embeddedLabel>, is opened within the Visual Studio solution.
trans-unit.target: After you click <embeddedLabel>Finish</embeddedLabel>, the schema file you created, <embeddedLabel>InsuranceClaim.xsd</embeddedLabel>, is opened within the Visual Studio solution.

trans-unit.source: You can now verify the schema that you created.
trans-unit.target: You can now verify the schema that you created.
